benchmark_details.name: Construction of a Benchmark Model for LSB Chinese Steganography
benchmark_details.overview: This study proposes a new method combining image steganography technology with Natural Language Processing (NLP) models aimed at improving the accuracy and robustness of extracting steganographic text. The method integrates error detection, correction, and semantic analysis for better information recovery.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To explore the issues of steganography and extraction of Chinese text, proposing an innovative LSB-NLP framework.

data.source: The data consists of Chinese text encoded in binary format for embedding into images using LSB steganography.
data.annotation: Data is not explicitly annotated; it is implicitly structured through the encoding and embedding process.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated as the ratio of correctly extracted characters to the total characters. MSE is computed for pixel-level differences.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and lower MSE indicate better performance in steganographic text extraction.
methodology.baseline_results: The extraction accuracy reached 100%, and MSE value was 0.2268.
methodology.validation: The framework was tested using various test images to evaluate its performance.
